title: JPD sUAS Report Metadata

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

The metadata from the file system where the JPD sSUAS reports reside.  This data is to include, file name, creation time, modify time, and other fields.  Under Missouri sunshine law I request this data be provided in screenshot form from the system where the files reside for safe keeping.  

Metadata, is "data about data." By the very existence of data, all manner of other data is created about that data. When a file is created, numerous records are created about that file in the file system and within the file itself. These electronic records that describe facts about JPD sUAS reports are what I am requesting. Anyone in the Joplin IT department will definitely be able to assist with this very brief task if it is not understood by the recipient.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael

title: Boston Family Days / Boston Family Museum

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Boston Family Days / Boston Family Museum
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to M.G.L. c. 66, § 10, I request copies of all records relating to any actual, proposed, draft, interim, or contemplated agreement or arrangement between the City of Boston (including any department, office, or agency) and the Boston Family Days / Boston Family Museum, including but not limited to:

1. All draft agreements, whether complete or incomplete, including all versions and revisions.


2. Any memoranda of understanding, term sheets, letters of intent, side letters, or informal written arrangements, whether draft or final.


3. All emails, attachments, and correspondence discussing proposed terms, scope, obligations, indemnification, insurance, licensing, access, or use of City property.


4. Internal City records reflecting approval, review, negotiation, or authorization of any such arrangement, whether or not a final agreement was executed.


5. Any documents reflecting an agreement in principle, course of dealing, or operational understanding, regardless of whether the documents are labeled as an “agreement.”



This request includes records in draft form and records that were never finalized or executed.

If any portion of the requested records is withheld, please provide a detailed exemption log identifying each record withheld or redacted, the specific statutory exemption claimed, and a brief explanation of how the exemption applies.

If no responsive records exist for any category above, please confirm that fact in writing and identify the custodians and systems searched.

Please provide the records electronically. If fees are anticipated, please provide a detailed written fee estimate before proceeding.

Thank you.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: Public Records Request – Five Below, Inc. (Post-Inspection Communications)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Public Records Request – Five Below, Inc. (Post-Inspection Communications)
communications.communication:
Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I request copies of all public records held by the Michigan Department of Agriculture and Rural Development from November 1, 2025 to present relating to Five Below, Inc., other than routine inspection reports already produced.

Specifically, this request seeks:

Any communications (emails, letters, memoranda, notes) between MDARD staff and Five Below, Inc. or its representatives following inspection findings

Any communications between MDARD and the Michigan Department of Attorney General referencing Five Below, Inc., Scanner Law compliance, or post-inspection status

Any internal MDARD communications discussing Five Below’s compliance, remediation, persistence, or repeat inspection outcomes

This request is not intended to duplicate previously produced inspection reports, but to identify any related communications or records created outside of the inspection reports themselves.

If no such records exist, please confirm that fact in writing.

Records in electronic format are requested where available.

title: Public Records Request – Five Below, Inc. (Scanner Law Compliance Records)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Public Records Request – Five Below, Inc. (Scanner Law Compliance Records)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of public records held by the Michigan Department of Attorney General from November 1, 2025 to present that reference or relate to Five Below, Inc. and Michigan Scanner Law (MCL 445.353 et seq.) compliance.

This request is limited to records that include one or more of the following:

Any written assurances, representations, remediation descriptions, or compliance statements made by Five Below, Inc. or its representatives to the Attorney General’s Office following the November 2025 Notice of Intended Action.

Any agreements, settlement discussions, assurances of voluntary compliance (AVC), assurances of discontinuance (AOD), corrective action frameworks, or compliance plans (formal or informal), including drafts.

Any correspondence (emails, letters, memoranda) between the Attorney General’s Office and Five Below, Inc. or its legal counsel regarding Scanner Law pricing compliance or remediation after December 15, 2025.

Any internal Attorney General communications that evaluate, summarize, or reference Five Below’s post-notice compliance status.

This request does not seek investigative strategy or attorney work product beyond what is required to be disclosed under FOIA.

Records may be provided electronically. If any portion is withheld, please identify the specific statutory exemption relied upon.

I request a waiver of fees as the records are sought in the public interest and for informational purposes.

Thank you for your assistance.

title: Virginia State University Policies

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia State University Policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of VSU Student Honor Code/Code of Ethics covering lying, cheating, stealing, plagiarism, etc.  
2. A copy of VSU Student Honor/Code of Ethics System detailing how violations of the Honor Code/Student Code of Ethics relating to lying, cheating, stealing, plagiarism, etc. are reported, charged, adjudicated with the range of sanctions and who receives reports and conducts the adjudication.
3. ROTC Commissioning rates by service from 2019 to present by race and gender.
4. Admissions policies, including any diversity goals or objectives by race and gender.
5. Copy of VCU's DEI policy and trainings, as well as whether student attendance is required.
6. Admissions data, including applications, acceptances, enrollment by race and gender from AY 2019 - 2020 - Present
7. Student retention data by class, race, and gender, from AY 2019 - 2020 - Present
8. Amount of funding received from the Virginia State University Alumni Association, VCU Foundation or related alumni groups, funds and/or endowments in total and as a percentage of the University's overall funding from AY 2019 - 2020 - Present
9. Any current concept papers or planning documents, reports or other matrials on the subject of the VSU BOV taking over governance f the Virginia Military Institute

The requested records are reasonably believed to be immediately available within existing records and, therefore, should be provided within the 5-day statutory requirement under the Virginia FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: DARPA: Atomic Machines, Inc. Contracts and OTA Records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DARPA: Atomic Machines, Inc. Contracts and OTA Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records relating to contracts, grants, and "Other Transaction Authority" (OTA) agreements between DARPA and Atomic Machines, Inc. (https://www.atomicmachines.com) (DUNS: 117144907; CAGE Code: 8D7X8) or any subsidiary.

Specifically, I am requesting:

Agreement Documentation: Copies of all awarded contracts, grant agreements, and Other Transaction (OT) agreements (including Research OTs under 10 U.S.C. § 4021 and Prototype OTs under 10 U.S.C. § 4022).

Proposals & White Papers: A copy of the technical proposal or white paper submitted by Atomic Machines, Inc. in response to any DARPA Broad Agency Announcement (BAA) or Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR/STTR) solicitation.

Evaluations & Rejections: In cases where a proposal was submitted but not awarded, provide the "Technical Evaluation" and "Selection/Non-Selection" letters.

Statements of Work (SOW): Detailed SOWs or "Milestone Schedules" that describe the specific MEMS fabrication capabilities or "Matter Compiler" benchmarks the company is contracted to deliver.

Communications: All correspondence (emails, letters, meeting minutes) between Jeff Holden or Klaus Zietlow (CTO) and DARPA Program Managers regarding the "foundational" or "dual-use" applications of their technology.

If certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

Thank you for DARPA's commitment to transparency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Police Information Sharing Policies with Immigration Authorities

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Police Information Sharing Policies with Immigration Authorities
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records: 

1. All departmental or municipal policies regarding communication and information sharing between departmental officers or employees and federal agents/agencies within the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) or the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS), including but not limited to the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). The records request includes, but is not limited to, policies regarding: 

A. Fingerprint and other data sharing, 

B. ICE detainer requests,   

C. Compliance with federal immigration enforcement efforts, including guidance or policies around when communication with ICE officers is allowed, and 

D. Communicating with federal immigration enforcement officers. 

This request covers any policies that are currently in effect or that have been in effect at any point on or after January 20, 2025. 

2. The three most recent communications (e.g., emails, text messages, call logs or transcripts, or otherwise) between a departmental officer or employee and a federal DHS or ICE employee. In addition, I request all records related to these communications, including, but not limited to, any records indicating that the department was made aware of the communications, discussions of their content or implications, evaluations them for compliance with departmental or other city policies, identification or acknowledgement of any potential policy violations, and any internal responses, disciplinary actions, or follow-up measures resulting from these communications. 

3. All records relating to incidents, if any, from January 20, 2025, to the day this request is responded to, in which an individual was taken from the department’s custody directly into ICE custody. For each incident, the records request includes, but is not limited to, booking and transfer records, communications with ICE or other federal agencies, internal documentation or discussion of the transfer, and internal notes, memos, or documentation referencing communication with DHS or ICE.

For each request, I am not seeking identifying information, and I will accept anonymized or redacted data as necessary to protect identities. 

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest. I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Joshua Dankoff 

Joshuadankoff@cfjj.org  

Director of Strategic Initiatives 

Citizens for Juvenile Justice  

(submitted via MuckRock platform)

communications.subject: Request Acknowledgement by DOJ-EOIR PAL
communications.communication:
Dear Lara Nochomovitz, 

This response acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request by the Executive Office for Immigration Review (EOIR).  Your request has been assigned control number 2026-22480. 

Please be advised that the status of requests submitted through the Public Access Link (PAL) may be tracked at https://foia.eoir.justice.gov/app/Home.aspx, and you will receive an email response to your request upon completion of processing. The status of requests submitted by email or mail may not be trackable through the PAL, but you will still receive an email or mailed response to your request upon completion of processing. (https://foia.eoir.justice.gov/app/Home.aspx) Please ensure the email address you provided in PAL will be able to receive the messages we send you. Messages rejected by your email account will not be rerouted to you. 
Please be aware that EOIR is a component of the Department of Justice and the custodian of records for the “Record of Proceedings” (ROP), which is the compilation of documents and digital audio recordings produced in proceedings before the immigration courts and the BIA. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) is the custodian of records for the “A-file,” which is a series of records of a person’s immigration history and is maintained and stored by DHS. EOIR is not the custodian of records for DHS or its components, nor does EOIR have access to DHS’s A-files. EOIR does not create an ROP until matters are initiated by DHS. Nevertheless, EOIR may create and maintain ROPs for proceedings other than removal proceedings (i.e., credible fear reviews, bond hearings). You may request a copy of your Notice to Appear (NTA) and full A-file from DHS. (https://www.dhs.gov/foia) 
Note that parties to immigration cases (including respondents and their representatives of record) have the option to request their Record of Proceedings directly from the immigration court or Board of Immigration Appeals. Please see the instructions here: https://www.justice.gov/eoir/ROPrequest. (https://www.justice.gov/eoir/ROPrequest) 

If you have filed a fee waiver request, EOIR will address the fee waiver in a separate letter. Most requests for records of proceedings do not require any fees; however, if the fees for processing the request are estimated to exceed $25.00, EOIR will notify you before processing the request to determine whether you will commit to paying the fee or whether you wish to narrow the scope of your request to reduce the fee. Fees may be charged for searching records at the rate of $4.75 (administrative)/$10.00 (professional) per quarter hour, and for duplication of copies at the rate of $.05 per copy. The first 100 copies and two hours of search time are not charged, and charges must exceed $25.00 before we will charge a fee. 

The FOIA requires an agency to respond within 20 working days after receipt of the request, and EOIR endeavors to meet this standard.  The FOIA permits a ten-day extension of this time period, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B), based on unusual circumstances.  Your request involves “unusual circumstances,” and EOIR is extending the time period to respond by an additional 10 working days because your request requires the collection of records from field offices, or involves a search, collection, and review of voluminous records, or requires consultation with another agency or two or more agency components. 

EOIR FOIA requests are placed in one of three tracks. Track one is for those requests that seek and receive expedited processing pursuant to subsection (a)(6)(E) of the FOIA. Track two is for simple requests that do not involve voluminous records or lengthy consultations with other entities.  Track three is for complex requests that involve voluminous records and for which lengthy or numerous consultations are required, or those requests that may involve sensitive records.  As a matter of default, your request has been placed in track two for simple requests.  If you have requested expedited processing, EOIR will contact you in a separate letter. 

If you have any questions regarding unusual circumstances, you may contact the EOIR FOIA Service Center or FOIA Public Liaison at EOIR.FOIArequests@usdoj.gov to discuss reformulation or an alternative time frame to process your request, or for any further assistance regarding any aspect of your request. Alternatively, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, Room 2510, 8601 Adelphi Road, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001; e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at (202) 741-5770; toll free at (877) 684-6448; or facsimile at (202) 741-5769. 
 
Sincerely, 

FOIA Intake

title: FY2024 prisoner operations details

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FY2024 prisoner operations details
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

(1) any record(s) detailing the average daily population of all individuals remanded to the custody of the U.S. Marshals Service in FY 2025 (or most recent fiscal year for which records are available), disaggregated or broken down by:
(a) sex; 
(b) most serious offense or charge (if that is not possible, then by offense category, i.e. violent, property, drugs, other new offense, weapons, immigration, supervision, material witness, etc.); 
(c) case status (i.e., convicted or unconvicted, or sentenced or unsentenced); 
(d) both sex and most serious offense (or if that is not possible, then by offense category) – i.e., the number of females in custody for each offense type and the number of males in custody for each offense type;
(e) both sex and case status (convicted or unconvicted, or sentenced or unsentenced) – i.e. the number of females in custody who are sentenced versus unsentenced and the number of males in custody who are sentenced versus unsentenced; and
(f) type of facility (i.e., state correctional facility, local correctional facility, privately owned or operated facilities, Federal Bureau of Prisons facilities, hospitals, or other).

If records are unavailable for the average daily population, records reporting the same information for any single day after January 1, 2024 (or the most recent day for which records are available) would be acceptable. Similarly, I would prefer records that contain this information reported as counts (totals), but if such records are unavailable, records reporting the same information by percent (percent of total) would be acceptable. I would also prefer the information be sent via email in PDF format, but would accept other electronic formats. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

I agree to pay any reasonable copying and postage fees of not more than $25. If the cost would be greater than this amount, please notify me. Please provide a receipt indicating the charges for each document. 

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial, including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wendy Sawyer

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Documents (emails,proposals, plans, etc) related to 6651 E Vernor - Department of Planning and Development
communications.communication:
This email serves as the City of Detroit’s response to the above-referenced matter. Your request was received at the City of Detroit Law Department Freedom of Information Act Section via facsimile or email on January 28, 2026. Because your request was received by electronic transmission, pursuant to Section 5(1) of the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (the “Act”), MCL 15.235(1); it is deemed to have been received at the Law Department on the next business day, January 29, 2026.

Pursuant to Section 5(2) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2), the City’s response is due within five (5) business days. However, due to the nature and the scope of your request and the volume of the requests received by the City, we are extending the City’s response deadline by ten (10) additional business days in accordance with Section 5(2) (d) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2) (d). Therefore, your request will be granted, denied, or granted in part and denied in part on or before February 19, 2026.

Your request is being handled by Devin Farrelly. If you have questions regarding your request, or if you did not provide an email address in your request, please forward it to Devin Farrelly at farrellyd@detroitmi.gov<mailto:farrellyd@detroitmi.gov> to provide you a response more readily than by regular mail or fax. Mail and fax are not preferred at this time since they both require in-office support. We thank you in advance for your understanding.

Fields of interest (standard census fields):

  - LEGAL_NAME, DBA_NAME                                                                                                                             
  - PHY_STREET, PHY_CITY, PHY_STATE, PHY_ZIP

  - DRIVER_TOTAL (drivers)                                                                                                                           
  - MCS150_MILEAGE, MCS150_MILEAGE_YEAR                                                                                                              
  - CARRIER_OPERATION (interstate/intrastate)                                                                                                        
  - CARGO types (CRGO_* fields)                                                                                                                      
  - Authority status fields

Preferred format: CSV, pipe-delimited text, or any machine-readable format.

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Clark County Sheriff's Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Clark County Sheriff's Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Sedgwick County Sheriff)

communications.subject: The Kansas Open Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Sedgwick County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Kansas Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: KORA Response re: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Sedgwick County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Mr. Sinyangwe,

The appropriate email address for these requests is either sheriffrecords@sedgwick.gov<mailto:sheriffrecords@sedgwick.gov> or KORA-FIO@sedgwick.gov<mailto:KORA-FIO@sedgwick.gov>
The Finance Division, who you originally sent this to, cannot respond to your request.

I am forwarding to Sheriff Records. If you do not receive a response within three (3) business days, please let me know so I can troubleshoot.

[cid:image001.png@01DC9062.BA4C4E70]

Jennifer Scriven, MA | Records Manager & Freedom of Information Officer | Sedgwick County Department of Central Services
